Class Console

  • java.lang.Object
    • Console
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PickPokemonConsole

    public class Console
extends java.lang.Object
    Console.java This class emulates a console's behavior.
    Author:
    Charles-Jianye Chen
    See Also:
    ConsoleTest

      • cd

        public int cd(java.lang.String param)
        This method emulates the behavior of "cd" command under win/xinx. It does not check if "path" exists.
        Parameters:
        param - the param passed by inputHandler(which is the user input excluding the first token).
        Returns:
        CMD_SUCCESS
        See Also:
        CMD_SUCCESS

      • inputHandler

        protected int inputHandler(java.lang.String cmd,
                           java.lang.String param)
        This method distributes the command by input.

        This Method Should Be Overwritten.

        This Method Should NOT Be Called Directly. (Call inputHandler(String) instead)

        Parameters:
        cmd - the first token of the user input
        param - the rest of the user input
        Returns:
        the result of handling this command

        return values: CMD_SUCCESS(0): handled cmd, successfully. CMD_RETURN_VOID(-1): handled cmd, cmd return type is VOID. CMD_NOT_HANDLED(-2): not handled cmd, could be handled in the overwritten methods. anythingelse: cmd-specific results.

        See Also:
        ConsoleTest.inputHandler(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

      • inputHandler

        public boolean inputHandler(java.lang.String userInput)
        This method handles the user input, parses it, then distributes it.
        Parameters:
        userInput - the line of user's input
        Returns:
        true.

      • parseInput

        protected java.lang.String[] parseInput(java.lang.String userInput)

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • next

        public boolean next()
        Instead of letting main() to do all the rough work, calling to this method will handle the console behaviour automatically.

        while (console.next());

        Returns:
        true if the console is not yet terminated.
        See Also:
        main(java.lang.String[])
